means: [口语]差不多，简直（用于加强语意）

sentence.Network_en: Until next payday, I was literally without any money.
sentence.Network_cn: 到下个发薪日前，我真的没有一点儿钱了。

sentence.Network_en: To see my body literally wither away before my eyes was exasperating.
sentence.Network_cn: 眼见自己的身体日渐衰弱真是让人心烦。

sentence.Network_en: Windsor Castle is quite literally an antique treasure trove.
sentence.Network_cn: 温莎城堡确实是名副其实的古物宝藏。

entry.tran: 简直（一些用词谨慎者认为此用法不正确）
entry.def: You can use literally to emphasize a statement. Some careful speakers of English think that this use is incorrect.

example.ex: We've  got to get the economy under control or it will literally eat us up...
example.tran: 我们必须设法控制经济，不然它非把我们吞噬了不可。
景色美得简直让人窒息。

entry.tran: 确实地；真正地；不加夸张地
entry.def: You use literally to emphasize that what you are saying is true, even though it seems exaggerated or surprising.

example.ex: Putting on an opera is a tremendous enterprise involving literally hundreds of people...
example.tran: 上演一台歌剧是一项浩大的工程，说要涉及数以百计的人真是一点都不夸张。

example.ex: I literally crawled to the car.
example.tran: 我真的是爬到车那边去的。

entry.def: If a word or expression is translated literally, its most simple or basic meaning is translated.

example.tran: volk这个单词直译过来为folk（人们）。

example.ex: A stanza is, literally, a room.

entry.def: If you take something literally, you think that a word or expression is being used with its most simple or basic meaning.

example.ex: If you tell a person to 'step on it' or 'throw on your coat,' they may take you literally, with disastrous consequences.
example.tran: 如果你告诉一个人step on it（“加速；加快”，字面意义“踩在上面”）或者throw on your coat（“赶快穿上外套”，字面意义“扔在你的外套上”），他们可能会按字面理解你的话，那就会引起灾难性的后果。

means.word_mean: 2. (intensifier before a figurative expression) without exaggeration;

sentences.sentence: "our eyes were literally pinned to TV during the Gulf war"

auth_sentence.content: Life, literally, isn't complete without it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Life, literally, isn't complete without it.

auth_sentence.content: You literally need to have two men against him.
auth_sentence.res_content: You literally need to have two men against him.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You literally need to have two men against him.

auth_sentence.content: I take the Bible seriously, but not literally.
auth_sentence.res_content: I take the Bible seriously, but not literally.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I take the Bible seriously, but not literally.

Sentence.sentence: It is figuratively and literally otherworldly in its aims.

sentences.cn: 他逐字逐句地翻译这段文字。

sentences.en: She was literally blue with cold.

jushi.english: She was literally blue with cold.
The Olympic Games were watched by literally billions of people around the world.
jushi.chinese: 全世界确实有几十亿人观看了那次奥林匹克运动会。

jushi.english: He was literally blazing with anger.
